intro: Acosta schousboei, commonly known as the Schousboei's acosta, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
